Comments_List: Philosophical argument, how to talk about God, distinguishing between philosophy and theology, arguments and motivations for the omni God/natural theism God

Good and up-to-date readings, good feedback on papers, good assignments. Seminars were a bit challenging just because the professor wasn't happy with many answers; at the same time his small lectures were usually clear and helpful

I would recommend this course to somebody interested in the topics on the syllabus, which are genuinely covered. It's a better course for those interested in philosophy I think than in religious studies or theology, but it also feels like it requires a background in theology. Doing the readings and thinking about them and going to office hours might help you learn more than seminar discussion.
